CatDescriptText: Sam Seillaeba, advertiser, North Side and Doris Hampson, hospital staff aide, Munhall were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Mr. Seillaeba's answer reads: " I don't know if it is necessary, and would hate to see it increased, but if it has to be, it has to be." Ms. Hampson's answer reads: "I would be, if the increase wouldn't double the present amount...Not only are more policemen needed, but also they need an increase in salaries."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sam Seillaeba wearing fedora with dark band and flecked overcoat, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Doris Hampson wearing light colored coat with dark fur collar, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
